bibl.title: Religious Perceptions of the Mine in the Eastern Desert in Ptolemaic and Roman Times .

Life on the Fringe. Living in the Southern Egyptian Deserts during the Roman and Early-Byzantine Periods. Proceedings of a Colloquium Held on the Occasion of the 25th Anniversary of the Netherlands Institute for Archaeology and Arabic Studies in Cairo 9-12 December 1996
bibl.note: Suite d'une série d'articles "Autour de": IDEM, L'univers minéral dans la pensée égyptienne = Bibliothèque d'Étude. 105/1-2 (Le Caire, 1991). - 1. Introduction. - 2. The Nomes and Their Links to the Traditional Economy of the Neighbouring Deserts, Sources of Minerals. - 3. Greek and Roman Pharaohs and Min. - 4. Min, Pharaoh and the Mining Tradition According to Egyptian Texts. - 5. Min and Pan of the Desert. - 6. Aphrodite and Isis. - References.
